fields.body:
Watermark Community Church will be hosting a Marriage Ministry Training Conference for all church leaders (staff and lay leaders) who would like to get an inside look at working marriage ministry models. Whether you don't know where to begin your marriage ministry, would like to improve what you are already doing, or would like to revitalize your church marriage ministry, then come join us.

Our next Marriage Ministry Training Conference will be on October 17-18, 2018. Registration will open in May of 2018.

fields.intro:
### Description
Whether your marriage needs to be reignited, re|engaged, or is in need of a complete resurrection, re|engage is a safe place for couples to reconnect. re|engage offers hope to marriages by helping couples move toward oneness through stories of grace, teaching and small groups. Join us for this 16-week experience which includes a time of music, prayer, a teaching or testimony by a couple who has experienced victory in the midst of hard times, and small group time which follows a specified curriculum.

fields.body:
## Wednesday
9:00am: Session One – Conference and Marriage Ministry Overview
10:30am: Break
11:00am: Session Two – 10 Common Marriage Ministry Mistakes
12:00pm: Lunch
1:00pm: Session Three – Raising Up Marriage Ministry Leaders
1:45pm: Break
2:00pm: Tracks Begin
- Track 1: Intro to Premarital Ministry and Newly Married Ministry
  - Premarital Ministry, Part 1
- Track 2: Intro to re|engage 
  - Overview of re|engage
  - Leader Meeting, Large Group, Newcomers, Open Group, Closed Group, Celebration Night
  - Curriculum Overview
- Track 3: Advanced re|engage 
  - Church Reports: Best Practices & Biggest Challenges
  - Program Structure Topics
4:15pm: Break/Campus Tour
5:30pm: Merge and re|engage Leader Meeting and Dinner
6:30pm: Observe Merge and/or re|engage
8:40pm: (Optional) Merge Late Night

## Thursday
9:00am: Session Four – Wednesday Night Debrief
9:30am: Tracks Continue
- Track 1: Intro to Premarital Ministry and Newly Married Ministry
  - Premarital Ministry, Part 2
  - How to Launch Merge and Foundation Groups in your church
  - Newly Married Ministry, Part 1
- Track 2: Intro to re|engage
  - Support Model, Website, Top Challenges & Biggest Risks
  - How to Launch re|engage
- Track 3: Advanced re|engage
  - Pastoral Care
  - Leader Development & Care
12:00pm: Lunch
1:00pm: Tracks Continue
- Track 1: Intro to Premarital Ministry and Newly Married Ministry
  - Newly Married Ministry, Part 2
- Track 2: Intro to re|engage
  - Church Panel Q&A
- Track 3: Advanced re|engage
  - Shepherding People in Habitual Sin
  - Q&A
2:30pm: Break
2:45pm: Breakouts
- Helping Couples Survive an Affair
- Recruiting, Developing, and Retaining Leaders
- The Administrative Basics of re|engage
4:00pm: Session Five – Where Do We Go From Here?
5:30pm: Dinner with the team

Pricing per person is as follows:
- Individuals: $129 per person
- Groups of Two: $129 per person
- Groups of Three or more: $109 per person

Price will increase $20.00 per person two weeks prior to event start date. Fee is non-refundable one week prior to start date.

IMPORTANT NOTE:
The Marriage Ministry Training Conference is open to any church who is looking to start or improve their marriage ministry. However, in order to use the Watermark marriage ministry materials you must agree with these [doctrinal beliefs](http://marriagehelp.org/statement-of-faith "Statement of Faith").

fields.name: Cindy Fiala
fields.miniBio: Family Ministry Pastor - Preston Trail Community Church, Frisco, TX
fields.quote: Healthy families are a big deal for all of us. At Preston Trail our 'one word' to describe who we are as a church and the primary center of our ministry, is 'FAMILY'. After hours of research we concluded that the number one way we could serve our community was to offer a well-balanced and vibrant marriage ministry. We already had a good start to building a strong marriage ministry, but knew there was more we wanted to offer. When we heard about the MMTC, we went curious and came away excited believing we had found the missing piece of our marriage ministry puzzle. The team at Watermark is like family to us, they are one of the most Kingdom-minded ministries that we have the pleasure of partnering with… they share what they’ve developed over years of trial and error, are available to talk, and walk alongside other churches as they begin ministering to couples. What they offer is a huge gift to the Church!

fields.title: Getting Ready for the Empty Next

fields.body: Whether your marriage needs to be reignited, or is in need of a complete resurrection, re|engage is a safe place for couples to reconnect. re|engage offers hope to marriages by helping couples move toward oneness through stories of grace

fields.name: Eric Swanon
fields.miniBio: Leadership Network, Co-author of the Externally Focused Church and To Transform a City
fields.quote: One of the biggest ‘white spaces’ on the missional map of the church is helping marriages and relationships thrive—both in the church and in the community. But precious few churches really know what to do to build healthy and growing marriages. Watermark’s Marriage Ministry Training Conference is a motivational, practical, and scalable approach to church-based marriage ministry. You will come away with a vision and a plan.

fields.body:
The [Westin Park Central](http://www.westindallasparkcentral.com/) is within walking distance to the church. To make a reservation at the Westin for this conference, you can [book online](http://www.starwoodhotels.com/westin/rates/rate.html?propertyID=472&rp=SN:430499,,,&language=en_US&EM=oneclickURL_430499_SETWATWD_BOOK_WI_472_NAD).

The Residence Inn Park Central is also within walking distance to the church. To make a reservation at The Residence Inn, you can call (972) 503-1333. Be sure to mention you are with Watermark’s Marriage Ministry Training Conference.

[Learn more about Watermark’s location](http://www.watermark.org/dallas/about/contact-us).

![11 parking map final2017-with-East-Tower](//images.ctfassets.net/<CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID>/21fiko9ujeI0aQGYA2ocOO/92b39a05989fa3f4e9747389b3ce1aa1/11_parking_map_final2017-with-East-Tower.jpg)

Uber and Lyft are available in Dallas and both are a great option for transportation to and from the airport.

Please contact [resources@watermark.org](mailto:resources@watermark.org) with any questions.

fields.detailedDescription:
1. Prevent Burnout
Prevents staff burnout and fatigue as it creates a clear path for counseling couples. One of our biggest reasons for starting re|engage was to help offload the marriage counseling burden felt by our church staff. Volunteers can be positioned for success to take on this responsibility (2 Peter 1:3).

1. Create Service Opportunities
Creates service opportunities for the local body of Christ. re|engage drives a need for leader couples who in turn love other couples at a time when they are hurting (1 John 3:18). And leader couples often experience improvement in their own marriage as a result of serving!

1. Reach the Unchurched
Couples who may never walk through the front door of your church may be driven to re|engage and the good news of Jesus Christ by the pain they are feeling in a strained marital relationship (Matthew 11:28).

1. Make Disciples
Provides a great opportunity to make disciples. The re|engage curriculum is the gospel applied to marriage (Ephesians 5:25). Take a look at the first lesson by clicking here. Participants in re|engage are often confronted with a loving God they have never met and ultimately embrace His free gift!
